subject: Economics
title: The Bank of Amsterdam: Trust in a Vault
description: One-minute skill: The Bank of Amsterdam: Trust in a Vault.

hook.text: In 1609, Amsterdam created a bank that didn't lend money. It just held deposits and guaranteed their value.

buildup.text: Europe's coins were so debased that merchants couldn't trust any of them. The bank verified and standardized.

discovery.text: A 'bank guilder' was worth more than coins because it was guaranteed. Banks created money more trusted than gold.

twist.text: Secretly, the bank lent to the Dutch East India Company. When discovered in 1790, the bank collapsed. Trust destroyed.

climax.text: The Bank of Amsterdam proved trust is money's foundation â€” and that betraying trust destroys any currency.

punchline.text: A bank built on trust died the day it broke that trust.

quiz.question: Why did the Bank of Amsterdam collapse?
options: It secretly lent deposits to the Dutch East India Company, breaking its no-lending promise
